definitions.definition: the fleshy muscular organ in the mouth of a mammal, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in humans) articulating speech.
the equivalent organ in other vertebrates, sometimes used (in snakes) as a scent organ or (in chameleons) for catching food.
an analogous organ in insects, formed from some of the mouthparts and used in feeding.
the tongue of a hoofed mammal, in particular an ox or lamb, as food.
used in reference to a person's style or manner of speaking.
examples: he was a redoubtable debater with a caustic tongue
the prioress chatted to the peddler in a strange tongue

definitions.definition: see the gift of tongues below.
a thing resembling or likened to a tongue, in particular.
a long, low promontory of land.
a strip of leather or fabric under the laces in a shoe, attached only at the front end.
a projecting strip on a wooden board fitting into a groove on another.
the vibrating reed of a musical instrument or organ pipe.

examples: a tongue of flame flashes four feet from the gun

definitions.definition: sound (a note) distinctly on a wind instrument by interrupting the air flow with the tongue.
lick or caress with the tongue.
examples: the other horse tongued every part of the colt's mane
